content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Regular expression to match markdown code blocks starting with ` and ending with the same number of `s
    re = r"```julia([^`]*)```"
    
    # Collect all the julia code blocks
    codes = Regex.captures(re, md)
    
    # Join the code blocks together
    joined_code = join(codes, "\n")
    
    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from each line
    cleaned_code = replace(joined_code, r"^(\s+)" => "")
    cleaned_code = replace(cleaned_code, r"(\s+)$" => "")
    
    return cleaned_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` containing Markdown with Julia code blocks and returns a string with all the extracted Julia code blocks joined together without any code fence characters.
